pull.title: Use std::move() instead of copying/removing in TxMemPool
pull.body: Fix for #8099 . Don't know if the solution is clean enough, but still. Tried to make changes as small as possible, thus the raw pointer and the optional parameter.

events.body: Moving from a de-referenced shared_ptr is kinda wonky. How about passing a pointer to a list of shared_ptr instead, which you would grab using GetSharedTx rather than GetTx. Then as a bonus, you can use splice() rather than moving.
@theuni, you mean replace `list<CTransaction>` with `list<shared_ptr<CTransaction>>` at the very top in removeForReorg(), or just in RemoveStaged()
@yurizhykin I mean everywhere this PR adds a `std::list<CTransaction>* removed` param, use `std::list<std::shared_ptr<CTransaction> >* removed` instead.
OK, will fix it. Thanks for guidelines.
Concept ACK on passing shared_ptr instead.

events.message: Use std::move() instead of copying/removing in TxMemPool

events.body: Okay, I'm not 100% sure I did exactly as I was told to, but as list for storing deleted transactions is passed down the stack from some top level point (in `main.cpp` and some tests), I had to replace `list<CTransaction>` declarations with `list<shared_ptr<const CTransaction>>` ones everywhere at those points. Also removed redundant `list<CTransaction> result` local variable declaration in `CTxMemPool::removeConflicts()`.

I completely forgot about this PR when writing #8515. That one goes further though, and is based on top of #7946 (which this would need rebasing on).

Do you still plan on working on this?
Well, as long as it is done way better in #8515, I should probably just close this one.
